message: Now that was just scary. My Windows 7 PC did not want to login. The PC started just fine until the login screen. After typing in my password it just stayed on the loading screen from there onwards. I rebooted a few times and could login via safe mode. Eventually I did a System Restore from in Safe Mode, which has now allowed me to access my PC once more.
Ohh Enter submits here. Anyway my biggest fear was having to redownload all my Steam Games. Time to put my Blu-ray disc writer into use it seems.
Shift + Enter gives you a new line. I don't know how to do a new line on the iPhone app, though.
Mine's sitting at 150 gigs. And that was after I did some backups as I was running out of space fast.

If you have your Steam folder on a seperate partition/hard drive, you don't have to redownload any of your games though. When you reinstall Windows, you can simply run the Steam exe from that folder, and everything will still be there.
Thanks Broken that is good to know. I check my Steam folder size and at present it gets to 77Gb.
